Explanation:

1. "9.9dialkylfluorene unit" is identified as a Material Name because it is a specific chemical compound that is being referred to in the context of the paragraph.
2. "OPVs such as poly[2,7-(9,9'-dialkylfluorene)-alt-5,5'-(4'',7''-di-2-thienyl-2'',1'',3''-benzothiadiazole)] (PFDTBT)" is identified as a Material Name because it is a specific chemical compound that is being referred to in the context of the paragraph. It is also a type of Organic Photovoltaic (OPV) material.

The "Property Name" entities in the paragraph are:

1. 8,9 A 9.9dialkylfluorene unit
2. donor - acceptor - type conjugated polymers
3. OPVs (Organic Photovoltaics)

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

After re-evaluating the entities, I have determined that all of them refer to material properties. Here is the updated table:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| 8,9 A 9.9dialkylfluorene unit |
| donor - acceptor - type conjugated polymers |
| poly[2,7-(9,9′-dialkylfluorene)-alt-5,5′-(4′,7′-di-2-thienyl-2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole)] ( PFDTBT ) |

1. 8,9 A 9.9dialkylfluorene unit: This is a specific type of fluorene unit, which is a common building block in organic electronics and photonics.
2. donor - acceptor - type conjugated polymers: This is a general category of materials used in organic electronics and photonics, where one part of the polymer (the "donor") is electron-rich, and the other part (the "acceptor") is electron-poor.
3. PFDTBT: This is a specific type of donor-acceptor conjugated polymer, with a fluorene-based donor and a benzothiadiazole-based acceptor.
